byline.contributor: Nick Madigan contributed reporting from Miami.

abstract: Donald Trump has become source of ongoing irritation for Jeb Bush, waging campaign of personal insults and playing off fears of white, conservative voters as he pulls ahead in polls; dynamic has put damper on Bush's sunny style of politics that seeks to focus on policy and positivity; Bush's aides fear Trump's endless taunts may be causing Bush to dip in polls.
lead_paragraph: As Mr. Trump turns the primary into a tabloid-style clash of personalities, Mr. Bush is stuck in a race that embodies what he likes least about politics.

headline.main: A Once-Sunny Jeb Bush, Bristling in the Long Shadow of Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: A Once-Sunny Bush Bristles in the Long Shadow of Trump

snippet: As Mr. Trump turns the primary into a tabloid-style clash of personalities, Mr. Bush is stuck in a race that embodies what he likes least about politics.
